page.title: 07CLUBS IN SANDHEAD
page.content: by Ian Rowan aged 12 For such a small village, Sandhead has a lot of clubs. Some meet in the summer, some in the winter and some throughout the year. Some clubs are for adults, some for all ages, and some for children. For adults we have the Churhwomen's Guild and the Darts and Dominoes Club. From about 9 years old you can join the Bowling, Tennis and Badminton Clubs. If you are still at school you can be a Brownie, Cub, Scout, or even as a young adult you may be a Venture Scout. My Mum coaches the wee ones at the Tennis Club. It costs Â£1 to be a member and 20p for each game you play. You need to have your own racket and balls. The Bowling Club charge Â£12 to join and 25p each night you attend. They are building a new clubhouse with a bar, snooker table, and indoor bowling mats.
